name: Grand Hotel Ambasciatori

reviews.title: Very average hotel at very high price
reviews.text: Beautiful location, but very bad rooms, especially standard - no view at all in a kind of shaft with sky showing two, three stories high. Professional reception, but this is all what can be said about this hotel. Go to the next door neighbour - Hotel Riviera,

reviews.title: Molto bene
reviews.text: much nicer rooms, great reception, very helpfull and much better food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed in room 605 which is a fabulous room with spectacular water views and quite spacious. We were extremely impressed with the girls on the front desk who were very polite and helpful. They suggested a fabulous local restaurant for dinner as well. The ocean sun-baking/swimming area is beautiful and highly recommended. The pool and garden area is lovely and very well maintained.
reviews.title: Wedded Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was not as good as what we had hoped for, but the other features of the hotel made up for this. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Hotel is almost everything it sets out ot be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My Fiancé and I booked via an agent, having weighed up the alternatives for a wedding abroad. We had a "wedding planner" through the agency also, but before we left we put down a deposit for our wedding reception at the hotel also. In hindsight this could have been a very hasty choice that could have blighted our wedding.
reviews.title: Spectacular!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorrento was the final stop on a two-week trip for my husband and I through Italy. We waited to really splurge until our last stop and we are glad we chose the Ambasciatori. We stayed here from 7/12-15, 2009 and we had a terrific stay. Our room was truly incredible. We booked into the doppa premier and were given a small suite on the second floor above reception (room 605). The room was absolutely huge with an initial sitting room with large window and flat screen tv, couch and chairs. Down the hall was a large bathroom on the right and then into our main room. Our room had huge french doors leading onto a small balcony with the most amazing view I have ever seen.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in a Beautiful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach (a dock floating on the sea) was great and the pool was beautiful as well. Breakfast was just ok, but in fairness, I have food allergies so it limits what I can eat. The only negative we had was the bar staff, one of which was rude. But we brushed it off as there are idiots everywhere.
reviews.title: Not 4 Star at all !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was fabulous - less than a 10 minute walk into town (especially if you cut through the little park down the street) and the Circumvesuviana.
reviews.title: The total package!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We can't recommend the Ambasciatori enough and we will be back!
reviews.title: Relaxed, Resuscitated and Reorientated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know all of these reviews are personal preference but I really would strongly recommend that you look else where. Although the rooms and hotel was clean the overall hotel is very dated and shabby, the bath was very old and you would definatley only stand in it !!! Pool is extremley small and the bar area adjacent to it very 2/3 star !!! We paid for the top Prestige room which states will be on a high floor but we were only 1 abvoe reception with a remaining 2 floors above us, I asked on reception why we were not higher and she said that the rooms that were above were a grade lower than what we had, so dont waste your money on a higher room upgrade, reception were generally unhelpful. Finally the location of the hotel, it is about a 10 miniute walk into the centre of town which is fine but this is a busy road not a quiet road as once again described by the hotel, also more importantly it is an very unpleasant walk and it is not lit up at night. I forgot one more thing, the football stadium is directly opposite the hotel dont stay in the footie season !!!
reviews.title: Brilliant staff and sea views but outdated with disappointing food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one week beginning the 21st of August 2009. We had researched many hotels in Sorrento before our trip, as we planned to hold our Wedding reception at this hotel during this stay.
reviews.title: First Class Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009
reviews.text: We were married on Monday the 24th of August at the Cloisters in the town of Sorrento, we then held our reception at the Grand Hotel Ambasciatori after this service. We had a total of 47 guests and many of our party had not travelled to Italy before.
reviews.title: More Than Expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were welcomed by all of the staff (including the manager Giovanni). It was immediately clear the staff could not do enough for us and catered for our every need. The hotel has a very grand entrance and when you walk outside on to the terrace it is like something of a movie. That is, it is one of the most beautiful views of the bay of Naples and absolutely breathtaking.
reviews.title: Great views of Naples and Mt. Vesuvius

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We soon settled into the hotel and I must say that the food was out of this world. We sat outside on the terrace for all of our meals and the waiter staff were very professional and again could not do enough for you.
reviews.title: A Great 4* Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent most of the time before the wedding lounging by the pool or down at the waters edge on the jetty, Again, the atmosphere was so relaxing and the weather was fantastic. The Hotel supply an endless amount of towels and the pool and sea temperatures were so warm that we spent most of the time in the water.
reviews.title: A Brilliant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here recently for 5 nights, found the hotel okay, nothing special though. It's a 10 minute walk to the town if you want to run the gauntlet of the usual tourist tat - on the main street of Sorrento you could be anywhere in the world.
reviews.title: More like little Britain than Italy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant on just 1 night, we found the atmosphere stuffy and the food mediocre. I would not book here again, in fact I would not come back to Sorrento, but if I were to consider this neck of the woods again I'd stay on the other coast, maybe Amalfi.
reviews.title: Fabulous views if you're in the right room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We went with Citalia , probably wouldn't use them again. The hotel has a wonderful location and the views are superb if you get the right room. We paid extra for a side sea view room which was well worth it to wake up to such an amazing view each morning. If you go avoid room no 702 which was our initial allocated room - we could hear the lift whirring and thumping each time it was used although the room itself is not near the lift, this noise went on until after midnight and resumed again at 6am. The room we were moved to was nearer to the lift but thankfully no lift noise. When we requested a room change because of the noise we found the reception staff very considerate apart from the very arrogant manager who told us that it was not possibel to hear the lift and that we should have paid more to get a full sea view room(non available when we booked).That did leave a bit of a nasty taste. Service in the restaurant got slower as the days went by and on our last evening we waited almost an hour between courses. However the food was very good and the waiters very pleasant..Not too thrilled with the entertainment but that was just our opinion and could well leave others thrilled.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, with great private beach and wonderful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I often visit this hotel on my own which because of the friendly staff is never a problem. I love the location of the hotel and its spectaluar views across the bay of naples - hard to beat! One of the main reasons I return to the hotel is its private beach which is exremely well run by Salvatore who goes out of his way to make all guests feel welcome and comfortable.
reviews.title: Can not fault it, had a brilliant time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar and restaurant staff - particularly Pasquale the head barman - are also really friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Excellent in All Ways

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: I do not recommend absolutely this hotel, because our room did not have good visual,and it was in conditions of little cured maintenance and the kitchen was unpleasant!
reviews.title: Holiday not to repeat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a delightful stay at this beautiful hotel this summer with our family group of 10 people in 5 rooms. The hotel catered to our request to be together and we got beautifully large rooms with wonderful views. I was a bit nervous about our rooms because we booked on Venere.com and got a great rate. I wasn't sure how the hotel would treat us for booking at a discounted rate on the internet, but I was pleasantly surprised. Our kids (7,10,10,10, 13) all loved it too. Especially Salvatore down at the marina!! I would defintely go back.
reviews.title: Great Spot!

likes.disliked: — slow service at the breakfast buffet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: The hotel has been advised, but it has disappointed our expectations:
reviews.title: One vacation to forget!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: - the kitchen was unpleasant,
reviews.title: An exceptional experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: - the dirty rooms, -
reviews.title: An Amazing Experience and Fabulous Hotel. You'll Love it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to Sorrento to get married, and wanted to stay in a good hotel - and we were not dissappointed! We had a sea-view room, and the views from the balcony were absolutely fantastic! The room itself was very nice, with a huge kings-size bed. The bathroom had quite a small bath, which made it a bit awkward to shower in. We stayed half-board, and the food in the restaurant was excellent, and nice size portions as well, so that you could eat everything and not feel totally stuffed! The hotel would organise a buffet in the gardens one a week, which made for a wonderful setting, but they did seem to get quite swamped as the entire hotel always seemed to turn up at once! My advice would be to let it die down a bit first before going to the buffet, otherwise you might be waiting a while for a waiter to bring you drinks. The hotel has beautiful gardens, and although the pool was quite small, this did not really matter as the jetty leading out to the sea was very nice. The sea itself was great to swim in, and I would recommend getting a snorkel to see all the fish swimming around. The location of the hotel was good, being only a short walk from the main square.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorrento is a wonderful place and we will definitely be returning to The Ambasciatori in the future, although I think next time we will only stay bed and breakfast, as you miss out on all the great little restaurants in the town by going half-board.
reviews.title: A class hotel in every sense of the word

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just come back from a week stay at the ambasciatori, where we also celebrated our wedding reception. What a week and what a hotel....
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As this was our wedding we decided to shell out a little bit more than we would normally on a room and got a superior room with a garden view. However the garden view was more like a see view as as soon as we came out onto our balcony, you could see a large part of the sorrento bay and a fantastic view of the sea.
reviews.title: Top class hotel - can't believe there are any bad reviews !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wifes parents stayed a couple of nights for the wedding and they had a superior room with sea view. The view from their balcony was nothing short of breathtaking and I would recommend anyone to get one of these rooms if they could afford it.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week staying at the Grand Hotel Ambasciatori and we didn't want to leave. The hotel is in a wonderful location, about 10 minutes walk from central Sorrento - it is in a quiet residential area, and the walk in to town is very pleasant. It is situatied high on the clifftops and has magnificent views of the bay and of Mt. Vesuvius - it was wonderful sitting eating breakfast each day taking in the scenery. The hotel also has a small pool and absolutely lovely grounds with plenty of places to sit and relax. Our room was lovely with 2 balconies, nice and clean, traditionally decorated and very comfortable. Breakfast is buffet style with a good choice. We had dinner there one night, the food was very nice but pretty expensive.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel and stunning location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we absolutely loved everything about this hotel and would definitely go back, I can imagine it being absolutely packed in summer so would recommend April/May time.
reviews.title: breakthtaking
Relaxation and Beauty
reviews.text: My husband and I just loved this hotel. It was so grand, the views were breathtaking and the rooms lovely. We were on one of the upper levels with a small bird's nest balcony but we felt so privileged to be there and gaze out at the most beautiful views I have ever seen. The staff were always obliging especially in the restaurant. It took us only 10 minutes to walk into central Sorrento so it was very convenient. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any of my friends. A seafacing room is so worth it. Just check out my photos to see for yourself.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had been travelling throughout Germany and Italy. We stayed in The Ambasciatori and just loved it! Our middle grade room was great with a view of partial sea and courtyard where you could hear the live Italian music from below at night. The reception area was full of high quality wood inlay and the internet was great. The walks into town (10 minutes) helped to walk off all of the great Italian food we had been eating. One day we stayed at the hotel all day as the setting is just too beautiful to not enjoy it, plus we needed the day to chill. We swam at the beach, had lunch poolside under a beautiful arbor, and then swam in the pool. It was a great way to chill from all of our travelling. The food was good, we did have a chef make breakfast in the main dining room as you watched and lunch was super as well. Dinner was good, nothing to write home about, but the view of Mt. Vesuvius and the sunset was just spectacular. I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Feels like a resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, view, lobby, pool, restaurants. Our room however, was kind of dingy and dark and had no view but the rest of the hotel made up for staying there. If you want a beautiful room with a view, prepare to pay major dollars. Wait staff was excellent espeically Valentino. Taxi from train station to hotel is very pricey but we were
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Upon arrival, we were shown to our room which was very dark and small. The third bed for our son had been pushed against the doors to the balcony, almost blocking the door. We asked to be moved to another room, after showing us 2 other rooms, we accepted the largest, which was actually a suite. This room was nicely furnished, still quite dark, but as it was larger, was more acceptable. The shower screen was very rusty, but the bathroom was clean.
reviews.title: Average Hotel, Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: The restaurant was very poor, both for dinner and breakfast. At breakfast, the selection was average, with no hot food on offer at all. The juices tasted watered down and hot drinks took an age to arrive. Dinner was exceptionally poor, with two of our three main courses being sent back. We chose not to eat there again. Retauarant staff were miserable.
reviews.title: Highly recommended
best ever ho;iday
reviews.text: Reception staff were excellent, very helpful at all times. Shame the rest of the staff did not follow suit. The reception area gave a very nice impression.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel location was very good, far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the centre, but still within a comfortable walking distance.
reviews.title: Perfect Wedding Reception Location

likes.disliked: — Minor point but the service was sometimes a bit slow for the evening meals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid 300 euro's a night for our room for 3 including breakfast and I feel this is very steep for the standard of this hotel. I would not recommend it.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

description: Characterized by the uniqueness of its position close to the city centre, the Grand Hotel Ambasciatori, is a prestigious 4 star Superior rating Hotel, immersed in the green of a luxuriant secular park, on a cliff overlooking the sea, with a breathtaking view of the Gulf of Naples and Vesuvius. Quiet location, exclusive private beach and parking.Located in the residential area of the city, few minutes walking from the centre of Sorrento, the hotel is characterized by a warm and intimate atmosphere, made of particulars loved by Guests looking for a deluxe treatment both for leisure and business holidays. The inners are furnished in a classical and refined style, with large and comfortable sofas, chairs realized by local craftsmen, valuable decors, marbled staircases, hand painted tiled flooring through out the corridors, fine antiques and paintings.Guest Rooms and Suites at the Grand Hotel Ambasciatori, enjoy a spectacular view of the Gulf of Naples and Vesuvius, or the luxuriant secular park.Hotels is provided with a private swimming pool, with hydro massage area, and private beach, reachable with an internal lift directly from the floors.
